translation.en: Li Jinbao.
Mongols.
They have already destroyed the temple at North Peak.
translation.zh: 他们已经毁了北峰的庙

translation.en: -Where are the nuns? -In the cloisters. East.
Remember the oath. We fight to the end.
translation.zh: 记住那句誓言 我们誓死抵抗

translation.en: [Hundred Eyes] Life and death are one thread.
I will guard the scrolls.
[woman] Li Jinbao!
Do not kill him.
The Khan will want this one.
What kind of monk is able to kill, by himself, 25 Mongol soldiers?
translation.zh: 什么样的道士能一人杀死25个蒙古士兵？

translation.en: Is it a form of dark magic practiced at your temple?
translation.zh: 你在道观中修炼的是邪魔之术？

translation.en: You shall never know, shall you?
translation.zh: 你永远不会知道 好吗？

translation.en: What did you just say, monk?
You destroyed a temple
and all of the ancient scrolls that contained the answers you seek.
translation.zh: 那些古经卷中藏着你要的答案

translation.en: You monks were offering shelter to my enemies in South China.
translation.zh: 你们这些道士为我中原南部的敌人提供庇护

translation.en: No place defies the Khan.
translation.zh: 任何地方都不得反抗大汗

translation.en: I will ask you again.
If you hold your tongue, I will take your tongue.
translation.zh: 你要缄默不语的话朕就割去你的舌

translation.en: What is this fighting art kept secret in a mountain temple?
translation.zh: 一座山间小庙藏了什么武学秘密？

translation.en: -The art of peace. -[Kublai chuckles]
You break the necks of trained soldiers,
translation.zh: 朕的士兵都训练有素却被你拧断脖颈

translation.en: cut their throats, gut them like wild pigs,
translation.zh: 切断咽喉 掏出内脏遭到野猪般的对待

translation.en: and you call it peace?
You destroy a temple and call it destiny?
translation.zh: 你毁了一座庙却说那是天命？

translation.en: Kings of the past would not have shown you grace.
translation.zh: 过去的帝王可不会给你这种恩典

translation.en: Me, when I make war on a city,
I allow the craftsmen to live.
I conscript them into service... and they live.
translation.zh: 我会征召他们为朕效命他们都活着

translation.en: Here.
You will reveal these Chinese secrets to my war ministers.
translation.zh: 你要为朕的军中将领揭开汉人的武学秘密

translation.en: Reveal Chinese secrets... to fight the Chinese.
translation.zh: 用汉人的武学去攻打汉人

translation.en: Prove yourself useful, you can live.
translation.zh: 证明你有用 你就能活

translation.en: Defy my laws...
you'll die a death far worse than that suffered by the monks
translation.zh: 你会比那些道士死得惨

translation.en: who perished with your scrolls.
translation.zh: 他们已和你们的经卷一起灭亡

translation.en: Oh, you find humor in my decree?
translation.zh: 你以为朕的法令是开玩笑吗？

translation.en: There is only one Supreme Executioner.
translation.zh: 世上只有一个神能主宰别人的命运

translation.en: And those who try to take his place
translation.zh: 谁要试图谋夺他的位置

translation.en: are like children trying to carve wood as a master carpenter.
Most will injure their own hands.
You do not fear death?
I do not cling to life.
There is a difference.
Remove him.
This wrestler is named Black Steppe Boar.
translation.zh: 这位摔跤手叫“黑色草原野猪”

translation.en: A prisoner captured in Scythia.
translation.zh: 是我们在辛西亚的俘虏

translation.en: Do you know why he is named after the boar?
translation.zh: 知道他为何要以野猪命名吗？

translation.en: His resemblance is extraordinary.
translation.zh: 二者有惊人的相似之处

translation.en: He is called Boar because he has killed such without a weapon many times.
translation.zh: 他叫“野猪”是因为他曾多次徒手杀死野猪

translation.en: Boar will advance. He will seize you.
You will demonstrate how to break the grasp.
You cover my eyes?
Is that just?
The Great Khan wants a report on how you fight blindfolded.
translation.zh: 大汗想知道蒙住双眼后你如何打斗

translation.en: He is a most capricious fool.
translation.zh: 他是最反复无常的傻瓜

translation.en: And if you were not cowards, you would tell him the same.
translation.zh: 若你不是懦夫就该对他说同样的话

translation.en: [yelling] Quiet, monk!
The general you killed was the son of Subutai.
translation.zh: 你杀死的将军是速不台之子

translation.en: Do you know that name, monk?
I do not.
[Kublai] Greatest military commander ever to serve Genghis Khan.
translation.zh: 成吉思汗麾下最骁勇善战的将领

translation.en: You slayed his son.
This is a crime beyond crimes.
Yet...
you do not cling to life, as you say.
translation.zh: 正如你所言 你不贪生

translation.en: Death means nothing.
What is a Khan to do?
A merchant once gifted me a white crane from Lesser Armenia...
translation.zh: 一名商人曾向朕进贡了一只小亚美尼亚的白鹤…

translation.en: a water bird that was most uncommon...
translation.zh: 是一种极为罕见的水鸟…

translation.en: because it had been born all black.
Black white crane.
I knew it was an auspicious being that would bring me fortune, but...
translation.zh: 朕知道它是个吉祥物能带给朕好运…

translation.en: that black white crane refused to stay on my lake.
translation.zh: 但那只黑色的白鹤不肯在朕的湖里停留

translation.en: Always, it would fly away.
Just its natural calling, you see.
translation.zh: 那是它的自然天性使之

translation.en: So...
I served him and my fortune...
translation.zh: 朕只好剪掉它一只翅膀…

translation.en: by cutting one wing.
[justice minister reading] "By law of the Grand Khan, Lord of Lords..."
[Kublai] Why do you think I had you fight blindfolded?
translation.zh: 你以为朕为何要你蒙眼打斗？

translation.en: Because I'm a capricious fool?
translation.zh: 因为朕是反复无常的傻瓜？

translation.en: Or to see if you are capable
of your Taoist secrets and skills while in the dark?
translation.zh: 你能否在黑暗中展示道家的秘密武术？

translation.en: "So be it."
[Kublai] Because I knew the moment you were presented,
translation.zh: 因为你被带来的那一刻朕就知道

translation.en: you would not be like the obedient painter...
translation.zh: 你不会像乖乖就范的画师

translation.en: the resigned astrologer, the noble poet contented with wine.
translation.zh: 听天由命的占星师或是有酒就满足的贵族诗人

translation.en: You would refuse to serve the Mongol Empire.
translation.zh: 你会拒绝为蒙古帝国效命

translation.en: To this day...
that black white crane remains on my lake.
translation.zh: 那只黑色的白鹤仍在朕的湖中

translation.en: He is mine...
and he is beloved.
Are you now ready...
to teach my Ministers of Warfare?
translation.zh: 教授朕的军中将领了吗？

translation.en: Tea for the monk.
Do not confuse me with one of your holy Buddhists.
translation.zh: 别将我与你心中神圣的佛教徒混淆

translation.en: Wine.
You were punished for killing the son of Subutai.
translation.zh: 你因杀死速不台之子而受罚

translation.en: Never forget that.
I shall not.
The monks of Wudang spend their lives trying to achieve true emptiness.
translation.zh: 武当道士修炼一生只为达到太虚境界

translation.en: For only when the sage can overcome the self
does he enter into the Tao.
That is a dark mystery beyond all mysteries,
translation.zh: 那是超越所有神秘的黑暗秘密

translation.en: and a gift you gave to me.
Blind?
I now see the world with one hundred eyes.
translation.zh: 我现在犹如有百眼看世道

translation.en: Give him more wine.
I've just captured your horse.
I know.
Then know this.
There are four Taoist temples still standing in the Wudang Mountains.
translation.zh: 现在武当山上还有四座庙

translation.en: My men will go there in a fortnight and burn them to the ground.
translation.zh: 朕会派人在半月内赶到将其夷为平地

translation.en: At my single command,
your religion can be wiped off the face of this earth.
translation.zh: 你信仰的宗教就会从这世上消失

translation.en: Or it can live...
grow...
thrive...
if you prove its value to me.
translation.zh: 只要你向朕证明其价值

translation.en: By training your ministers?
And someone else.
[Hundred Eyes] You must be the prince.
I am called Altai.
[Hundred Eyes] Why are you here?
[Altai] Lessons.
And what do you intend to teach me
in these... lessons?
I'm here to teach you that even the son of a royal khan
translation.zh: 我来此是要教你即便是大汗的儿子

translation.en: is capable of humility and learning.
Then take the broom, Altai, and sweep my floor.
translation.zh: 那拿起那把扫帚 阿尔泰帮我扫扫地

translation.en: Good answer. If only you believed it.
translation.zh: 答得好 只要你相信

translation.en: You are a little nomad weed in the garden of the world.
translation.zh: 你是天下这个花园中的一株小野草

translation.en: They wish you to grow into a flowering tree.
translation.zh: 他们期望你长成繁花盛开的大树

translation.en: What is the most important part of such a tree?
translation.zh: 这棵树上最重要的是什么？

translation.en: The many branches and the flowering.
translation.zh: 枝繁叶茂 繁花盛开

translation.en: I speak of legacy.
Ah! Thank you for untangling your elusive metaphor.
translation.zh: 感谢你解开这个迷人的比喻

translation.en: We begin with roots.
[Altai] May I ask a question?
Do.
If you wish calligraphy on your wall,
why not summon a painter who can see?
translation.zh: 为何不召个明眼的画师？

translation.en: Can you not read the character I made?
It is a symbol for fire.
Then what is wrong?
-It's upside down. -Precisely.
This is the kung fu character for patience, control.
translation.zh: 这个字很费功夫考验耐心和控制力

translation.en: Remember this in the future, always,
"Never give way to anger."
Sifu?
Have I not trained you into exhausted silence yet?
translation.zh: 我还未把你训练到累得说不出话吗？

translation.en: Today's lesson is done, My Radiant Highness.
translation.zh: 今日的课业已结束 殿下

translation.en: You cannot see it, I know. But...
I assure you it has been overseen by a great Chinese architect...
translation.zh: 但朕可以告诉你此地由杰出的汉人建造师监造

translation.en: made from the most precious of woods and hides, and--
translation.zh: 用最珍贵的木材和兽皮还有…

translation.en: Imbecile.
Someone has painted the character of fire upside down.
I did.
On this day of the New Year...
I ordain this place the Hall of the Fourth Treasure.
translation.zh: 朕将此地命名为“四宝殿”

translation.en: I name you Hundred Eyes...
-[chuckles] -...Minister of Martial Affairs.
And so...
I ask of you, as a Wudang priest,
give my son his Chinese name.
translation.zh: 朕请你为朕的儿子起个汉名

translation.en: There have been 500 over time
who have held the name Emperor of All China,
Son of Heaven.
Ordained by blood,
there are those who would have been better suited to harvest cow dung
translation.zh: 比起统治天下最大的王国

translation.en: than to rule the greatest empire on earth.
There are those who were as silver,
a lesser metal, but worthy of coinage.
translation.zh: 一种较次的金属却有铸币之价值

translation.en: And then there are those...
like cold stone,
who force their strength and fury
translation.zh: 将其力量和愤怒强加于人

translation.en: and win the title by fear and intimidation.
Blood is nothing.
Heart and spirit make the sage.
translation.zh: 心胸和精神才能成就圣人

translation.en: And by this...
I give this boy the name Jingim.
"True gold."
So be it.
He will walk out of here with this name,
and carry it as his own into a tomorrow only the oracles can see.
translation.zh: 后世也会以此名铭记他

translation.en: As for you, priest...
this temple is yours.
